intro: Linaria amoi, commonly known as the yellow toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the plant family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and vibrant yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Linaria amoi produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
